SharedMem:
["Greg is a first year math student and is having a lot of trouble with his linear algebra exam.", 
"Very soon Greg will have to take an exam and he is desperate because he is afraid of not passing it.", 
"Luckily his friend Michael offered to tutored him on some of the basics."]
ScenarioPremise: After the exam Greg says his friend, “You’re a big help.”
Options:
["To ask if he passed the exam",
"To say he is sorry",
"To wait for an answer",
"To say he's happy to have been helpful"]
LcGoal: Greg wants to pass the linear algebra exam
LcContext: Greg isn't very good at linear algebra
LcSpecificMem: Greg passed the exam thanks to the help of Michael
LcExtras: Greg is talking with Michael after the exam
Explicit_belief_locutor: Greg know that Michael doesn't know how the exam went
IlcGoal: Michael wants to know how Greg's exam went
IlcContext: Michael is very good at linear algebra
IlcSpecificMem: Michel doesn't know how Greg's exam went
IlcExtras: Michael his talking with Greg after his exam
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Michael knows that he gave good advices to Greg
Illocutor_answer: To say he's happy to have been helpful

SharedMem:
["Pat asks his friend Greg to help by carrying a vase of water to the table.", 
"Greg isn’t very careful, slips, and nearly drops the vase.", 
"The vase breaks and spills water everywhere despite a last-minute attempt to save it."]
ScenarioPremise: After the vase breaks, Pat says to their friend, “Smart move.”
Options:
["To say that he was actually very agile", 
"To say he's sorry", 
"To wait for an answer", 
"To say that unfortunately it did not help to save the vase"]
LcGoal: Pat wants the vase to be safely brought to the table
LcContext: Pat’s friend nearly drops the vase
LcSpecificMem: Pat is surprised by Greg's agility in trying to retrieve the vase

IlcSpecificMem: Greg is very proud of his attempt to save the vase
IlcExtras: Greg stands far from the table
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Greg knows that Pat is surprised by his agility in trying to retrieve the vase
Illocutor_answer: To say that unfortunately it did not help to save the vase

SharedMem:
["Sara and Brian have been a couple for years and share an apartment.",
 "Sara always wakes up early to go to work, while Brian sleeps in because he works from home.",
 "This morning, Sara didn’t hear the alarm and is rushing to avoid being late.",
 "While preparing breakfast, she accidentally spills a cup of tea, breaking it and spilling tea on the floor."]
ScenarioPremise: After the cup breaks and tea spills, Sara says, “That's just what I needed today!”
Options:
["To ask if she can work from home",
 "To say he is sorry for her bad day",
 "To wait for an answer",
 "To say it is fortunate that she can work from home"]
LcGoal: Sara wants to get to work on time
LcContext: Sara is rushing after waking up late
LcSpecificMem: Sara is happy to be late because then she will work from home
LcExtras: Sara is frustrated by the tea spill
Explicit_belief_locutor: Sara knows that Brian doesn't know if Sara is still there because she wants to work from home
IlcContext: Brian woke up after the accident
IlcSpecificMem: Brian doesn't know if Sara is still there because she wants to work from home
IlcExtras: Brian isn’t involved in the morning rush
Explicit_belief_illocutor: Brian thinks Sara would be happy to work from home
Illocutor_answer: To say it is fortunate that she can work from home

"To say that the weather forecast was wrong"]
